prefix: Approach the following question the way someone with a PhD in mathematics would.
problem_prompt: Approach the following question the way someone with a PhD in mathematics would. What is the greatest common divisor of $7979$ and $3713$?
solution:
We can use the Euclidean Algorithm to find the greatest common divisor of these two integers. \begin{align*}
\gcd(7979, 3713) &= \gcd(3713, 7979 - 2\cdot 3713) \\
&= \gcd(3713, 553) \\
&= \gcd(553, 3713 - 6\cdot 553) \\
&= \gcd(553, 395) \\
&= \gcd(395, 553 - 395) \\
&= \gcd(395, 158) \\
&= \gcd(158, 395- 2\cdot 158) \\
&= \gcd(158, 79) \\
&= \boxed{79}.
\end{align*}
gpt_response:
To find the greatest common divisor of 7979 and 3713, we can use the Euclidean algorithm. 

First, we divide 7979 by 3713 to get a quotient of 2 and a remainder of 953. 

Next, we divide 3713 by 953 to get a quotient of 3 and a remainder of 454. 

Then, we divide 953 by 454 to get a quotient of 2 and a remainder of 45. 

Continuing in this manner, we eventually find that the greatest common divisor of 7979 and 3713 is 1. 

Therefore, the greatest common divisor of 7979 and 3713 is 1.
